column4: Networking question: a subnet of 255.255.240.0 is normal, but can I use non sequential bits?  i.e. can I create a subnet of 255.255.15.0 or something along similar lines (e.g. 255.255.96.0) ??
With standard subnet masks, no, you cannot.
really?  damn, and r3d2 and maxigas filled me with confidence :\
There are other masks, like wildcard masks in IOS, which can be used that way, but not subnet masks.
